jparsec.astrophysics.gildas

Class Spectrum30m

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astrophysics.gildas.Spectrum30m
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Spectrum30m
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class to hold the properties of an spectrum, including all the information from the header. The spectrum can be written as a .30m or .fits file. In the latter case it can be read by CLASS using the command FITS READ.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public double[] getSpectrumData()

        public double getReferenceChannel()

      • getChannelWidth

        public double getChannelWidth(double frequency)
        Returns the width of the channel for a given frequency, corrected for the change in the width with respect to the reference frequency in very wide spectra.
        Parameters:
        frequency - The frequency in MHz.
        Returns:
        Channel width in km/s. Actually it is the corrected velocity resolution, which could be a negative value.

      • getCorrectedVelocityForAGivenFrequency

        public double getCorrectedVelocityForAGivenFrequency(double frequency)
        Returns the correct velocity for a given frequency.
        Parameters:
        frequency - Frequency in MHz.
        Returns:
        Correct velocity in km/s, could differ substantially from that of Gildas.

        Returns the correct velocity for a given Gildas velocity.
        Parameters:
        velocity - Gildas velocity in km/s.
        Returns:
        Correct velocity in km/s, could differ substantially from that of Gildas.

      • getGildasVelocityForAGivenCorrectedVelocity

        public double getGildasVelocityForAGivenCorrectedVelocity(double correctedVelocity)
        Returns the Gildas velocity for a given corrected velocity.
        Parameters:
        correctedVelocity - Corrected velocity in km/s.
        Returns:
        Gildas velocity in km/s.

      • toCorrectedVelocity

        public SpectrumLine toCorrectedVelocity(SpectrumLine line)
                                 throws JPARSECException
        Transforms the parameters of this line from Gildas velocity to corrected velocity (corrected for relativistic effects so that the width of the channel changes with frequency). Usually the line parameters are referred initially to Gildas velocity, since Gildas is the source of the spectrum. Note an improper call could result in an instance inadequate to represent the fit to a given line, so use this call with care. Only velocity, velocity width, and area are changed.
        Parameters:
        line - The input line.
        Returns:
        The output line.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • toGildasVelocity

        public SpectrumLine toGildasVelocity(SpectrumLine line)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Transforms the parameters of this line from corrected velocity to Gildas velocity (not corrected for relativistic effects). Usually the line parameters are referred initially to Gildas velocity, since Gildas is the source of the spectrum. Note an improper call could result in an instance inadequate to represent the fit to a given line, so use this call with care. Only velocity, velocity width, and area are changed.
        Parameters:
        line - The input line.
        Returns:
        The output line.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getVelocityForAGivenImageFrequency

        public double getVelocityForAGivenImageFrequency(double frequency)
        Returns the Gildas velocity for a given image frequency.
        Parameters:
        frequency - Image frequency in MHz.
        Returns:
        Velocity in km/s.

      • getCorrectedVelocityForAGivenImageFrequency

        public double getCorrectedVelocityForAGivenImageFrequency(double frequency)
        Returns the corrected (non Gildas) velocity for a given image frequency.
        Parameters:
        frequency - Image frequency in MHz.
        Returns:
        Corrected velocity in km/s.

      • getVlsrForAGivenFrequency

        public double getVlsrForAGivenFrequency(double frequency,
                               double fref)
        Returns the velocity for a given frequency as Gildas does, without considering relativistic corrections, and using a new rest frequency.
        Parameters:
        frequency - Frequency in MHz.
        fref - The new rest frequency to compute a new velocity scale, in MHz.
        Returns:
        Vlsr in km/s.

      • getReferenceImageFrequency

        public double getReferenceImageFrequency()
        Returns the reference image frequency of this spectrum.
        Returns:
        Image frequency in MHz, or 0.0 if that value cannot be retrieved from the current spectrum.

      • getReferenceFrequency

        public double getReferenceFrequency()
        Returns the reference frequency of this spectrum.
        Returns:
        Reference frequency in MHz, or 0.0 if that value cannot be retrieved from the current spectrum.

      • getSpectrumAsTable

        public java.lang.String getSpectrumAsTable()
        Return the spectrum as a table, containing channel number, Gildas velocity (km/s), frequency (MHz), and intensity. Each line is separated by a line separator.
        Returns:
        The text of the table.

      • getChartWithLines

        public CreateChart getChartWithLines(SpectrumLine[] lines,
                            Spectrum30m.XUNIT xunit)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Returns a chart with this spectrum including a set of Gaussians. Only valid lines are drawn into the chart (lines enabled and not deleted in their corresponding internal flags).
        Parameters:
        lines - The set of Gaussians.
        Returns:
        The chart.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getAsSpectrum

        public Spectrum getAsSpectrum(Spectrum30m.XUNIT xUnit)
                       throws JPARSECException
        Returns the current 30m spectrum as a general spectrum object.
        Parameters:
        xUnit - The unit for the x axis. Y axis will be main beam temperature.
        Returns:
        The spectrum.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • writeAs30m

        public void writeAs30m(java.lang.String path)
                throws JPARSECException
        Writes the data in the .30m file.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the output file.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • writeAsFITS

        public void writeAsFITS(java.lang.String path,
               boolean forGILDAS)
                 throws JPARSECException
        Writes the current spectra to a .fits file. The spectrum can be written in standard 64 bits/pixel (double), or in a compatible format with GILDAS, limited to 32 bits/pixel (float). The reduction from 64 to 32 bits/pixel will cause a minimum lose in precision.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the file.
        forGILDAS - True to write the spectrum in a compatible way with GILDAS.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • readSpectraFromFITS

        public static Spectrum30m[] readSpectraFromFITS(java.lang.String path)
                                         throws JPARSECException
        Reads a set of 30m spectra from a fits file exported by Gildas, in SPECTRUM or INDEX modes.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the .fits file.
        Returns:
        The set of spectra from the file.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the input file is invalid.

      • readFromFITS

        public int readFromFITS(java.lang.String path)
                 throws JPARSECException
        Reads the spectrum in a .fits file.

        An example of a full FITS header is: 

         SIMPLE = T /
 BITPIX = -32 / 
 NAXIS = 4 / 
 NAXIS1 = 256 / 
 NAXIS2 = 1 / 
 NAXIS3 = 1 / 
 NAXIS4 = 1 / 
 BLOCKED = T / 
 BLANK = -1000.0 / Blanking value
 BSCALE = 1.0 / 
 BZERO = 0.0 / 
 DATAMIN = 0.8968728496914817 / 
 DATAMAX = 0.9888023167848587 / 
 BUNIT = K / 
 CTYPE1 = FREQ / 
 CRVAL1 = 0.0 / Offset frequency
 CDELT1 = -1.0 / Frequency resolution
 CRPIX1 = 127.5 / 
 CTYPE2 = RA---GLS / 
 EQUINOX = 2000.0 / 
 CRVAL2 = 325.7570478593505 / 
 CDELT2 = 0.0000000000000E+00 / 
 CRPIX2 = 0.0000000000000E+00 / 
 CTYPE3 = DEC--GLS / 
 CRVAL3 = 66.05655580294503 / 
 CDELT3 = 0.0000000000000E+00 / 
 CRPIX3 = 0.0000000000000E+00 / 
 CTYPE4 = STOKES / 
 CRVAL4 = 1.0000000000000 / 
 CDELT4 = 0.0000000000000 / 
 CRPIX4 = 0.0000000000000 / 
 TELESCOP = 30M-1M4-B230 / 
 OBJECT = N7129S       / 
 LINE = SO2(11210)   / Line name
 RESTFREQ = 2.0530057E11 / Rest frequency
 VELO-LSR = -10.0 / Velocity of reference channel
 DELTAV = 1460.2612 / Velocity spacing of channels
 IMAGFREQ = 2.1381566535578754E11 / Image frequency
 TSYS = 4509.677 / System temperature
 OBSTIME = 2400.0 / Integration time
 SCAN-NUM = 5721 / Scan number
 OBS-NUM = 6740 / Observation number
 TAU-ATM = 0.5581591 / Atmospheric opacity
 GAINIMAG = 0.0316 / Image sideband gain ratio
 BEAMEFF = 0.576 / Beam efficiency
 FORWEFF = 0.91 / Image sideband gain ratio
 ORIGIN = JPARSEC / 
 DATE = 2008-03-04T18:26:32.465 / Date written
 TIMESYS = UTC / 
 DATE-OBS = 2004-06-07T05:06:01.8317326 / Date observed
 DATE-RED = 2004-06-07T00:00:00.0 / Date reduced
 ELEVATIO = 17.708361883400332 / Telescope elevation
 AZIMUTH = 375.7734875815459 / Telescope azimuth
 UT = 05:06:01.8317326 / Universal time at start
 LST = 03:14:14.860806 / Sideral time at start
 LON = 0.0 (Longitude of the observatory)
 LAT = 0.0 (Latitude of the observatory)
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the .fits file.
        Returns:
        Number of errors found when reading the header, due to the absence of certain header parameter or to an incorrect data type. Fits format using in Gildas has evolved and changed since the first versions, and many parameters are not present, so more than 20 errors is normal. Currently 24 is the usual value.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • writeAs30m

        public static void writeAs30m(Spectrum30m[] sp,
              java.lang.String path)
                       throws JPARSECException
        Writes the data in the .30m file. Currently the general, position, spectroscopy, baseline, and calibration sections are written.
        Parameters:
        sp - The spectrums to be written.
        path - Path to the output file.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • resample

        public void resample(Spectrum30m s30m)
              throws JPARSECException
        Resamples this spectrum to the resolution and velocity range of another one. All new values outside the velocity window currently covered are set to 0.
        Parameters:
        s30m - The reference spectrum to resample to.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • modifyRestFrequency

        public void modifyRestFrequency(double freq,
                       boolean useRelativisticCorrection)
        Modifies the rest frequency for this spectrum.
        Parameters:
        freq - The new rest frequency in MHz.
        useRelativisticCorrection - True to use relativistic correction for the velocity axis. As a general rule, say false for Gildas spectra.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test program.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
